fine_dining.name: Ristorante Zeffirino
signature_dishes: Branzino al Sale (Sea Bass in Salt Crust)
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant restaurant with views of the harbor and historic Genoa
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2-3 months in advance, especially for weekend dinners
fine_dining.local_tips: Famous for their pesto alla genovese; ask about their traditional preparation methods

fine_dining.name: Ristorante Il Marin
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated dining with panoramic views of the Mediterranean
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve at least 3 weeks in advance, request terrace seating in warm weather
fine_dining.local_tips: Arrive early to enjoy the sunset views over the fishing village before your meal

fine_dining.name: Ristorante Le Rune
signature_dishes: Risotto ai Frutti di Mare (Seafood Risotto)
Orata con Verdure di Stagione (Sea Bream with Seasonal Vegetables)
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant dining with contemporary design and harbor views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2-3 weeks in advance, request window table for harbor views
fine_dining.local_tips: Their wine list features excellent Ligurian wines; ask for local recommendations

fine_dining.name: Ristorante Il Genovese
fine_dining.atmosphere: Opulent restaurant with vaulted ceilings in historic Genoa
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 1 month in advance, request garden seating in summer
fine_dining.local_tips: Their seasonal seafood menu is extraordinary when available

fine_dining.name: Ristorante Da Gaia
signature_dishes: Trofie al Pesto con Fagiolini (Pesto with Green Beans)
Branzino con Verdure di Stagione (Sea Bass with Seasonal Vegetables)
fine_dining.atmosphere: Refined dining with open kitchen and organic focus
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve 2 weeks ahead, mention if you prefer counter seating to watch the chefs
fine_dining.local_tips: Many ingredients come from their own garden; seasonal menus reflect what's growing

casual_dining.name: Trattoria da Maria
casual_dining.atmosphere: Bustling family-run trattoria with communal tables
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; arrive by 12:00 PM to avoid long lines
casual_dining.local_tips: Closed for dinner; cash only. Daily specials are written on a chalkboard

casual_dining.name: Osteria di Vico Palla
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy and intimate, traditional Genoese osteria
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reserve a week in advance; no written menu, servers explain daily offerings
casual_dining.local_tips: Chef is a Genoa legend; they specialize in traditional Ligurian dishes

casual_dining.name: Antica Focacceria Sottoripa
casual_dining.atmosphere: Historic focacceria with traditional Ligurian breads
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; expect to wait in line up to 20 minutes in peak season
casual_dining.local_tips: Their focaccia is the key to their success; worth the wait

casual_dining.name: Il Marin
signature_dishes: Branzino al Sale (Sea Bass in Salt Crust)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Lively, rustic tavern with maritime decor and communal tables
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book several days ahead, especially for weekends
casual_dining.local_tips: Portions are generous; the house wine flows freely and is included in the price

casual_dining.name: Osteria del Mare
signature_dishes: Fritto Misto di Mare (Mixed Seafood Fry)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Warm and welcoming with indoor and terrace seating
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book 2-3 days in advance, request outdoor seating in warm weather
casual_dining.local_tips: Half portions of pasta are available to try multiple dishes

casual_dining.name: Pizzeria Da Gino
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; takeaway available if seats are full
casual_dining.local_tips: Try their pesto pizza for a unique Ligurian twist on the classic

casual_dining.name: Trattoria da Ugo
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy and bright with a focus on traditional Ligurian dishes
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book for dinner; lunch usually has space for walk-ins
casual_dining.local_tips: A rare vegetarian-friendly option that even meat-loving Genoese appreciate

street_food.name: Focacceria di Via San Lorenzo
street_food.local_tips: An institution since 1950; ask for it 'calda' (warm) for the best experience

street_food.name: Panificio Patrone
street_food.local_tips: Great for traditional Ligurian breads and focaccia

street_food.name: Focacceria di Boccadasse
street_food.local_tips: Perfect for a beachside snack while exploring the fishing village

street_food.name: Panificio Moderno
street_food.local_tips: A hole-in-the-wall with authentic Ligurian focaccia; eat standing up like a local

street_food.name: Focacceria del Porto
street_food.local_tips: One of the most famous focaccia spots; perfect for a quick lunch while exploring the port

coffee_shops.name: Caffè degli Specchi
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Historic and elegant café with Belle Époque interiors
coffee_shops.local_tips: Stand at the bar for authentic experience and lower prices

coffee_shops.name: Caffè Rivoire
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Traditional café with prime position overlooking Piazza de Ferrari
coffee_shops.local_tips: Their thick hot chocolate is a Genoese winter tradition

coffee_shops.name: Caffè degli Artisti
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Modern specialty coffee shop with artistic vibes
coffee_shops.local_tips: Genoa's first true specialty coffee bar; also has excellent local pastries

coffee_shops.name: Caffè del Teatro
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Historic literary café with elegant interiors and outdoor seating
coffee_shops.local_tips: A historic literary cafe where intellectuals have gathered since 1900

coffee_shops.name: Caffè del Porto
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Trendy concept space combining café, restaurant, and harbor views
coffee_shops.local_tips: Great for digital nomads during weekday mornings; transforms for aperitivo later

bars.name: Bar degli Specchi
bars.atmosphere: Stunning historic building with contemporary design elements
bars.local_tips: Request seating in the ancient cellar or courtyard; arrive early for a tour of the historic building

bars.name: Speakeasy Genova
bars.atmosphere: Secret prohibition-style bar with no signage and dim lighting
bars.local_tips: Requires reservation by text message; entrance is hidden and unmarked

bars.name: Terrazza del Porto
bars.atmosphere: Panoramic rooftop bar with harbor views
bars.local_tips: Make reservations for sunset; 360-degree views include the harbor and city skyline

bars.name: Bitter Bar Genova
bars.atmosphere: Small, intimate cocktail bar with knowledgeable bartenders
bars.local_tips: Bartenders create custom drinks based on your preferences; mention what flavors you enjoy

bars.name: Manifattura Genova
bars.atmosphere: Vintage 1950s Italian design with attentive service
bars.local_tips: Every spirit, mixer, and garnish is Italian; the perfect place to explore Italy's drinking culture

bars.name: Empireo Rooftop Bar
bars.atmosphere: Elegant rooftop terrace with unbeatable views of the harbor
bars.local_tips: Located on the 6th floor of a luxury hotel; one of the best harbor views in Genoa

food_tours.name: Mercato Orientale Food Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance; tours don't run on Sundays when many vendors are closed

food_tours.name: Boccadasse Food & Wine Tour
highlights: Seafood restaurants in the fishing village
food_tours.booking_tips: Reserve 10-14 days ahead; comfortable walking shoes recommended

food_tours.name: Ligurian Coast Half-Day Food & Wine Tour
highlights: Traditional lunch at a coastal restaurant
food_tours.booking_tips: Book early in high season (April-October); includes transportation from Genoa

food_tours.name: Gelato and Pastry Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Popular with families; afternoon tours recommended to avoid morning crowds

cooking_classes.name: Ligurian Cooking Class
includes: Market visit, ingredients, meal with wine, and recipes
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book 2 weeks ahead, especially for popular morning classes with market visits

cooking_classes.name: Seaside Cooking Experience
includes: Transportation to coastal location, seafood market tour, full meal with wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Reserve 2-3 weeks in advance; wear comfortable shoes for market tour

cooking_classes.name: Genoese Classics Workshop
includes: Ingredients, meal, wine, historical context of dishes
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Evening classes often less crowded; reserve 1-2 weeks ahead

markets.name: Mercato Orientale
markets.local_tips: The market closes early; best visited in the morning for fresh produce and seafood

markets.name: Mercato del Carmine
markets.local_tips: More authentic and less touristic than Mercato Orientale; where locals actually shop

markets.name: Mercato di Boccadasse
markets.local_tips: Genoa's best seafood market; great for fresh fish and local specialties
